Class Operators

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>

          • com.colofabrix.mathparser.Operators
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Operators
extends java.util.Vector<Operator>
    This class manage the collection of the supported operators in MathParser
    Author:
    Fabrizio Colonna

    • Method Detail

      • executeExpression

        public Operand executeExpression(Operator operator,
                        java.util.Stack<ExpressionEntry> operands,
                        Memory memory)
                          throws ExpressionException
        It executes the operation performed by the operator

        Every concrete implementation of Operator must implement this method with the operation that it has to do.

        This class will also set the variable "Ans" which contains the last result of an operation or Double.NaN if there is no result.

        Parameters:
        operands - A stack containing the operands in reversed order
        memory - A reference to the main math memory
        Returns:
        It returns a number if the operation succeeded or null to express empty-result
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - The exception is thrown when there is an evaluation problem

      • fromName

        public Operator fromName(java.lang.String word)
        It fetches an operator given its name

        The functions retrieves the operator corresponding to the name given. The name can be both a base name or a full name.

        Parameters:
        word - The name of the operator to fetch
        Returns:
        An instance corresponding to the operator found or null if no operator is found

      • getParsingRegex

        public java.util.regex.Pattern getParsingRegex()
        Create the regualar expression to match any supported element in MathParser
        Returns:
        A Pattern object for the regular expression

      • isOperator

        public boolean isOperator(java.lang.String word)
        Check if a given string is an operator

        The check is performed searching for a correponding existing operator

        Parameters:
        word - The string to check
        Returns:
        true if the string represents an operator
